creditline: The John R. Van Derlip Fund; purchase from the collection of Elizabeth and Willard Clark
description: moon at top with diagonal space outlined by ink washes jutting into lower edge of the moon; area immediately below moon demarcated by abstract washes of clouds
marks:
Signature and Stamp

LLC: [Rosetsu sha] LLC: [Rosetsu sha]
text: Rosetsu’s skillful use of ink wash poignantly evokes a hazy moonlit autumn sky. Reaching toward the sky are curlicues of what may be mist or ocean waves or even obscured mountain cliffs. While studying under Maruyama Ōkyo, whose Monkey Hanging from a Tree is also in this exhibition, Rosetsu developed an eccentric painting style and is highly regarded in Japan today.
title: Moon and Cloud
